intro: Elaeodendron oligocarpum, commonly known as the African olive, is a small evergreen tree native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Burseraceae and is characterized by its aromatic, leathery leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces drupes that are often used in traditional medicine. It thrives in dry, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and cultural contexts.
